title: Workshop on Strengthening Technology-Integrated Instructional Design Decision-Making Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design concepts and understanding of educational technology
context.additional_context: Participatory activities using Q methodology, enabling learners to explore diverse decision-making patterns in technology-integrated instructional design and reflect on their own approaches.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain their decision-making type in technology-integrated instructional design processes using Q methodology.
Learners can compare and explain technology integration strategies according to different teacher types (critical thinkers, practical users, time savers).
Learners can propose technology-integrated instructional design plans suitable for their educational context based on Q methodology results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
